item.title: Edge Kanban
item.description: Whole class visual progress charts originally based on kanban. How does a group of 7 teachers across various specialties experience the use of Edge Kanban in their student directed classes?

item.title: ECIS Schools
item.description: ECIS member schools Individuals and collaborative teams at ECIS member schools are invited to send proposals that document practices in: Natural feedback (students receive feedback as a direct result of their work, e.g. a robot controlled garden grows healthy plants, not drying out or flooding); Non-traditional formative feedback (e.g. from peers, through journaling, etc.) Using Learning Analytics in agile learning environments

item.title: Learning Centered Education
item.description: Professionalization of teachers and supporting students in learner centered education, LeX Applying Learning Analytics at the Open University Netherlands in partnership with Dipf University in Frankfurt in Germany and Delft University in The Netherlands.

item.title: Teacherless Observations
item.description: For schools with the goal of student-directed learning, classroom observations of just students - without the teacher - provide a measure of progress.
